body:
### Problem

The w_leftcol in a terminal window is not updated after terminal buffer is resized.

Commit where the bug appears: 2784a5d3d28004f95dfd4e31a825722440437fe1

The logic of this bug:
- The window changes its width
- win_set_inner_size() detects that number of columns has changed and tries to recompute w_leftcol. At this moment, we still have old terminal dimensions and cursor position, so it sets new value to w_leftcol, which is correct at this moment
- An event is sent to update terminal size
- When terminal updates its width, the cursor column can change position, so w_leftcol should be recomputed, which is not happening

Was able to fix it by updating w_leftcol after terminal resize, but i think that this solution is a bit hacky, and i'm not familiar enough with neovim codebase to come up with something better.
```patch
diff --git a/src/nvim/terminal.c b/src/nvim/terminal.c
index b6af223ea6..18b789f12d 100644
--- a/src/nvim/terminal.c
+++ b/src/nvim/terminal.c
@@ -2109,6 +2109,19 @@ static void refresh_size(Terminal *term, buf_T *buf)
   term->invalid_start = 0;
   term->invalid_end = height;
   term->opts.resize_cb((uint16_t)width, (uint16_t)height, term->opts.data);
+
+  FOR_ALL_TAB_WINDOWS(tp, wp) {
+    if (wp->w_buffer == buf) {
+      // For some reason curs_columns just alone, doesn't work well with
+      // floating windows
+      if (wp->w_leftcol != 0) {
+        wp->w_leftcol = 0;
+        redraw_later(wp, UPD_NOT_VALID);
+      }
+
+      curs_columns(wp, true);
+    }
+  }
 }
 
 void on_scrollback_option_changed(Terminal *term)
```

### Steps to reproduce

```bash
nvim --clean
:term
btop # Open any tui app that take control over cursor and set it to the mid/end column (e.g. btop, yazi or lazygit)
# Resize neovim at large amount of width in single tick
```

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25a0f691-0c38-4b1c-becb-dcee4df4d6a0)

### Expected behavior

Terminal window should reset w_leftcol after resize

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

v0.11.3 and v0.12.0-dev-1011+g38986188ba-dirty

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

Can't reproduce it in latest stable vim

### Operating system/version

Linux archlinux 6.15.9-zen1-1-zen

### Terminal name/version

alacritty 0.15.1 (0c405d53)

### $TERM environment variable

screen-256color

### Installation

pacman -S neovim or built from the repo
